did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Western Federation of Miners International Mine, Mill and Smelter Workers Records, 1893-1962
did.origination:
Western Federation of Miners;
International Union of Mine, Mill, and Smelter Workers
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Consist of documents collected by Professor Vernon H. Jensen for his work on the non-ferrous metals industry, specifically, relating to the WFM, the IUMMSW, and the Industrial Workers of the World (IWW). Includes constitutions, collective bargaining agreements, proceedings of concentions and minutes chiefly of the WFM and IUMMSW (1893-1943). Also, documentation relating to the rank and file orevolt of Butte, Montana, Local 1 (1955) and to the rivalry between the IUMMSW and the IWW (1917-1919), among other subjects.
did.langmaterial: Collection material in English, Finnish, Hungarian, Polish

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Western Federation of Miners (WFM) and its successor, the International Union of Mine, Mill and Smelter Workers (IUMMSW) were historically considered the radical wing of the non-ferrous metals miners' unions.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Additionally, include collective agreements of the Anaconda Copper Mining Company with the American Federation of Labor, Building and Construction Trades Department and various unions (1944): Anaconda Mill and Smelters' Union, Local 117 (1944, 1952), Butte Miners' Union, Local 1 (1936-1944, 1951), and the Great Falls Mill and Smelters' Union, Local 16 (1951); Utah Copper Company with the IUMMSW District No. 2 (1946) and various unions (1944-1946); and the Kennecott Copper Corporation with the Operating Engineers Union, Local 3 (1951).

Also, minute books of the Bingham Miners' Union, Local 67 (1904-1908), and Local 1 (1925-1931). Materials interfiled with the minute books of the Bingham Miners' Union include: manuscript notes and letters on membership organizing, resignation of union members, union election, defense fund, investigation of J.A. Boyle (member, Bingham Miners' Union) for misappropriation of union funds, and memorials for deaths of union members; letters and statements regarding Bingham miners' condemnation of Governor Frank Gooding (Idaho), and Governor Jesse MacDonald (Colorado) for conspiring to murder George Pettibone (president, WFM) (1906) and Bingham miners' demands that the marshall of the town be a union member and Socialist Party representative (1905); circular letters to members regarding political changes in the WFM and rivalry for political leadership (1916); union election ballots; and photographs of miners' homes in Bingham County, Utah (1906).

scopecontent.p: 1943 and 1950. Several letters pertaining to the administration of District No. 6 (Connecticut) IUMMSW by the International. Executive Board of the CIO during 1943 and a letter to members concerning the Investigation of communism in the IUMMSW .

1909 and 1917. Approximately 30 pieces of correspondence to and from E. S. McClusky, IUMMSW organizer during the 1917 strike at Jerome, Arizona. The letters deal with IWW-IUMMSW rivalry and the "deportation" of "IWW agitators" from Jerome during July 1917.

September 1922-March 1923. Papers relating to the creation of an independent union of mine-workers in the Silver Bow region of Montana, September, 1922 to March 1923. 12 pieces

did.unittitle: McLenegan to Brown, Thomas H. - Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Letters and telegrams written as a member of the Executive Beard and as organizer in the field to the President of the International Union of Mine, Mill and Smelter Workers. 53 pieces .

did.unittitle: Thomas H. Brown to McLenegan - Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Letters and telegrams written to the Secretary-Treasurer of the International Union of Mine, Mill and Smelter Workers, December, 1933, to January, 1935, concerning union affairs, organizing campaigns, the strike at the Liberty Montana Mines (May- August, 1934), financial matters, and personalities. McLenegan and Robinson seem to have been old friends; the latter's son Reid was financial secretary of Butte Miners No. 1 until his election to the presidency of the International in October of 1934 and several letters mention his activities. 120 pieces

Letters and telegrams written by the Secretary-Treasurer of tube International Union of Mine, Mill and Smelter Workers. Robinson remained at the International's offices In Salt lake City during most of this period. 71 pieces.

Letters and telegrams to or from IUMMSW officers George R. Coles, Vice-president; Charles J. Whitely, Daniel Orlich, Thomas S. Cole, members of the Executive Board, and President Reid Robinson. 32 pieces

did.unittitle: Organization and Internal Affairs of Several Locals

scopecontent.p: Papers relating to the several locals of the IUMMSW, and the attempts of workers or International Officials to organize additional local unions; Butte Miners No. 1; Great Falls M & S No. 16; Twin Bridges M & M Ho. 19; Pony M & M No. 21 (absorbed Mammoth Miners as part of agreement between Mammoth Miners and Liberty Montana Mine Co., 23 August 1934); Bennack M & M No. 22; Basin Miners No. 23; Phillipsburg M & M Ho. 24' Tooele (Utah) M & S No. 55; Butte Stationary Engineers No. 83; Anaconda M & S No. 117; Logan (Montana) cement workers; Helena; Virginia City (Montana); Deer Lodge; Big Timber; Fort Peck (U. S. Government project under direction of Army Engineers); Jardine. Considerable other information will be found in the correspondence cited above.

did.unittitle: International Union of Mine, Mill, and Smelter Workers Executive Papers

scopecontent.p: Accountant's report, 9 July 1931; Secretary- Treasurer's Reports; April 1926, May 1928, June-August 1931, April- June and September-November 1933; Minutes of the Executive Board: 3 April 1933 and 19 November 1933 to 7 January 1934, the last group concerning especially a dispute as to the legality of the returns filed by Butte Miners Ho. 1, and including papers relating to this election; proposed amendments to the IUMMSW constitution; IUMMSW "reports" to the several locals on union affairs.

did.unittitle: International Union of Mine, Mill, and Smelter Workers - Political Activities

scopecontent.p: Papers relating to the attempts of the International to influence the course of National legislation or local elections, See also correspondence to and from Brown concerning the copper code under NIRA. 10 pieces

Unidentifiable or otherwise miscellaneous papers, including IUMMSW printed material (contract forms, price lists, charters, blank ballots, & c.), receipts, some correspondence, lists of names, minutes of meetings, material on scabs, comments on the advantages of a six-hour day (e.g.), and some material relating to the organization of a farmer-labor cooperative and a Montana State Mining Council. Other papers on these last subjects will be found scattered through McLenegan's correspondence, especially to James Robinson.
